website_summaries.verdict: A good trailer and RV cover for most small-to-medium trailers. Comes in different sizes for the best fit.
pros: A large number of available sizes makes it easy to find the right fit for unique or semi-custom RV trailers
Individual access panels for doors and windows means you can use the cover while staying in the RV
cons: Some cover sizes are actually longer than their advertised length

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty high quality cover
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty high quality cover. It would have been nice to know you have to undo the straps before your first time putting it on. My camper is 19'-1". I bought the size for trailers up to 20'. It fit good. A little too much material in the front but that is probably because my trailer is sloping in the front instead just a flat front. Fit over the roof air conditioner and tv antenna just fine. The straps really pull it tight around the front, back, and underneath the trailer. Overall, great product. I hope it holds up to the Florida sun and summer thunderstorms.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: We were concerned about the quality of this cover, after reading the reviews about ripping, esp. in the wind. After installing the cover, we experienced 2 days of 20-30 mph winds with gust to 45-50 mph. We did put 2 extra ropes across the top of the trailer for support, but were very pleased with how well the cover held up. No rips or tears. We are very pleased with this cover's durability. Considering how large the trailer is, it was reasonably easy to install. Good instructions. We had questions about the use of some of the straps and contacted the company's customer service dept. who answered our questions promptly and helped us. I would recommend this cover.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: While this product seems to be of good quality when I spread it out over my 24' ...
customer_reviews.text: While this product seems to be of good quality when I spread it out over my 24' travel trailer the product, which was advertised to fit 22'-24' travel trailers, was at least a foot too short! I checked the return policy and I was four days too late! I am disappointed that I have a cover that doesn't cover my trailer and I'm apparently stuck with it. Don't believe the product description. Buy a bigger cover than I did.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ekblad

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Great cover and made it though 50mph winds so far. The trick is you have to cover up EVERY sharp spot on the trailer that could rip the cover. I used foam sheets made for packing material. Then wrapped the trailer a few times with plastic wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Jtab

customer_reviews.title: Torn cover. Please help
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely upset with my camper cover I have had on less than one month .. I searched reviews and waited to put it on after I got it because of snow. This is not nice and I need another one because wind ripped it I did not save box because it was large and don't know how to exchange it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roof material failed & tore at only 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The white roofing material became brittle and tore near my trailers rounded edges at only 5.5 months. Additionally the coating on the inside of the roof fabric failed earlier and left a white powdery mess all over my trailer that was glued on due to morning dew. I’ve had several Classic Accessories covers and none have lasted 3 years in the brutal California sun but for this one to last not quite 6 months is extremely disappointing. Photos attached.
customer_reviews.author: wreathandcrest

customer_reviews.title: Poor Cover Quality
customer_reviews.text: On 8-8-2019 I purchased this cover for my trailer. I installed it 10-1-2019, and you can see what has happened to the material. The warranty that comes from Classic Accessories does not cover this per phone call to them. It was to have a 3 year warranty. I would NOT buy this cover as the company has a way to get out our warranty, Not a very good manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself the time and hassle and don't buy this product. I followed the instructions to the letter, covering any sharp edge on the outside of my trailer. But the first time the wind got over 20mph, the cover tore right in half. It didn't even last a month. And thank goodness for that because I was still within my 30 day Amazon return window. Their company website where you are supposed to submit warranty claims doesn't exist.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Lichtle

customer_reviews.title: We'll see how it holds up!
customer_reviews.text: Much harder to put on trailer than I had anticipated but that's just because it's gigantic. The top is a multilayered mesh material that doesn't seem like it would keep the rain out. But, it has been raining a lot lately and the rain is dripping off the top of the cover instead of pooling so that's probably a good sign. Haven't gone in the trailer to check the known leaking areas yet. The zippers on the sides are cool and will make it much easier to get in and out of the trailer in the winter months. Overall, it seems like a good buy. I'm not sure how many seasons it will last, though. The material is pretty thin.
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: Horribly Faulty
customer_reviews.text: I used this cover for 4 months in the Florida winter (not our bad weather season by any stretch). The material that makes up the top covering the camper roof completely disintegrated. It literally just crumbled into hundreds of shreds. It was like the sun just obliterated the strength of that material. The sides were fine. Something is horribly wrong with this cover and I am seeking a refund. See pics. Remember, this is only after 4 months!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Bad fit
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible fit, it is way to long front to back for my 24 foot toy hauler and about a foot to short vertically, it claims to fit 118 in vertical but my trailer is only 108 in from the top of the luggage rack to the bottom of the trailer so I'mnot sure where they come up with 118 in. I just got around to putting this on and have now missed the return window by a day so I guess I am stuck with this.
customer_reviews.author: Andres S.

customer_reviews.title: Installed Fine
customer_reviews.text: Installed just fine. Will need 2 people to do so. THis was for my Travel Trailer. We hooked a rope to one end, and pulled it across the top of the camper. THen pulled down the sides and strapped them in place. Took about 15 minutes once we figured out the easiest way to get it on the camper. It seems to be good material and it did not rip or anything. Ask me next spring once it goes through the winter and I will update you how well it held up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon dr user

customer_reviews.title: So far, So good.
customer_reviews.text: This cover was easier than i expected to install. Did it alone (as long as you can carry the 30lb bag UP the ladder to the ROOF of the RV. Went on well. I live in a very windy and harsh winter area. I will update after winter is over and see where we are at then. For now, it's great. Quality seemed okay, top wasn't that much thicker than sides that I noticed anyways. Went on really easy. I have a 27ft and there was some extra but with the straps, it tightened up really well. Feel confident about it, especially with the 3 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste the money
customer_reviews.text: If I was able to give zero stars I would. Bought this item and it ripped within the first couple month. Contacted the seller and they sent me a replacement item. Just put the new cover on and have had it on for less than a month and it already ripped and a strap fell off. See pics
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 18’ toyhauler. It would not go over the rain spouts that stick out on the corners. Also the zipper pulled loose wile trying to zip it up. I cannot recommend this item as it doesn’t fit as stated.
customer_reviews.author: trippind27

customer_reviews.title: Rips easily, not durable, material is like tissue paper
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cover a travel trailer in southern California. It immediately ripped in small areas (ie over antennas, any corners, etc) upon putting it on - the material is super thin like a thick tissue paper. When I came back after a few weeks, you can see what I found in the attached picture. The mild socal winds were strong enough to rip the entire siding. Waste of $200
customer_reviews.author: O. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: NO, NO for ARIZONA Weather!
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, after tons of research and deciding on the PolyPro 3 cover...it did not even last 30 days in the Arizona sun. The thin white top completely disintegrated and particles were all over my yard! The gray sides of this PolyPro 3 seem to be a better/ thicker material...maybe if it was all made with the gray material it would have lasted longer? Don't know how this company will honor their 3 year warranty since this cover is a NO NO for Arizona weather and an exact replacement will be worthless to me. The pros is it I like how it fit camper and had multiple straps to keep in place.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Not an easy install or simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cover for a new 16' enclosed trailer. I needed something simple to take on or off - THIS IS NOT IT! This is mostly designed for yourself and 3 buddies to enjoy a day of frustration determining which way is what and trying to align straps and corners. Ended up throwing the whole deal in a box and returning it. I did give this 2 stars as it did seem to be a well manufactured piece of frustration. Went to Walmart and got a tarp and some straps for $25 - much cheaper and easier - a single person job.
customer_reviews.author: Reaper1

customer_reviews.title: Straps ripped after a month on my camper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cover after having owned covers from Classic Accessories and after recommendations from friends and family. I had a very different experience with this cover. It was shipped without the 4 straps needed to secure the cover underneath the camper. After a month installed the seams that held the female part of the strap on had ripped after a heavy wind and another one ripped clean off during installation. The durability where the straps connect to the cover is extremely low. I am very disappointed and will not be buying a cover from Classic Accessories ever again and its a shame because I am going to need a new one after 1 season.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Lattari

customer_reviews.title: Nicely constructed RV cover
customer_reviews.text: Nicely constructed RV cover. I used it for a 22 feet toyhauler and it fit a little too snug even though the cover says it can fit 22-24 feet trailers. The side zippers are a nice touch but don't expect it to be directly over your trailer door. Before I installed the cover, I slit some tennis balls and pushed them onto the rain gutters and the top ladder tips. If this is not done, it is highly possible the pointy areas will cause a hole in the cover. It has held up well through 2 southern California desert windstorms. I'm hoping that it last 4-5 years.
customer_reviews.author: albert92882

customer_reviews.title: This one fit my 20' single-axle Jayco Jayflight Swift just fine. They look impossible to clean after a year ...
customer_reviews.text: Covers, as a whole, blow... Literally and figuratively. This one fit my 20' single-axle Jayco Jayflight Swift just fine. They look impossible to clean after a year or so of dust and dirt from indoor (barn) storage, but we shall see. The price was right and it fits. Cinches up fairly easy. Should do for a few years, anyway. Seems like wind would shred it, but again, we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: T-Rok

customer_reviews.title: Longer than necessary.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cover for my Winnebago Plus 38RLSS trailer and it is about 4 feet longer than the trailer which makes for a sloppy fit. It is also difficult to install the first time because of the way it is packed. When first unpacking the cover, it is extremely difficult to figure out outside from inside, front from back and side from front or back. It took me 3 hours to finally find a marking on the cover that indicated where it's front outside was. That said, the cover appears to be very well designed and constructed.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Schramm

customer_reviews.title: They don't know how to measure!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cover our 28' travel trailer. Ordered the one for 28-30' so we'd have a little extra to cover the attached ladder. Not only does it not cover the ladder, even if there was no ladder it would be too short. Usually buy the one piece Poly Pro cover- figured I'd try one with more features. Won't make that mistake again! Going to have to cut slits in top material to make room for the ladder and then somehow attach the two sides on that corner since it still won't zip shut since it's so tight. Worst cover ever! Buy the cheaper one piece cover!
customer_reviews.author: Teachermom

customer_reviews.title: Thought this was worth the money now I know it isn't.
customer_reviews.text: I have never wrote a review before but I felt I had to on this item. I was thrilled with the quality of this cover but that did not last. I ordered this item last year I used it one winter, and when I just went to put it on for the winter it disintegrated. The entire cover just fell in half after an hour of putting it over my camper. Please don't waste your money pay for indoor storage instead or find another option. This item does not hold up even with following the care instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Jarred

customer_reviews.title: 5 1/2 Months and this cover turned to crap.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cover last July, Installed it the first week of August. I have never taken it off, it has been on my trailer on the side of the house protected from wind, just exposed to some sun and very little rain water. I live in San Diego about a mile from the ocean, no harsh elements and the top has basically come apart and exposed most of the top around all the edges and the AC on top is now exposed. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY IT WON'T LAST LONG.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: Installed this cover in the fall of 2019. It is now Feb. 2020 and it still in the same condition as when i installed it. Does not blow around in the wind. As long as you put straps in place you are good. HOWEVER, I do HIGHLY RECOMMEND that you install, RV Cover Rescue | RV Gutter Spout Cover System | Protects Your RV Cover From Gutter Spout Damage. If not, I guarantee your cover will be torn to bits as the wind will tug and pull at the corners where the camper gutters are.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought November 19th 2019. Took off today May 16th 2020. There are 3 different big tears and the white mesh is just FALLING apart. Absolutely ridiculous. I would like to be contacted for the supposed 3 year warranty. This didn't even last 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Momma of 3

customer_reviews.title: Purchased June 2015, after about 2 1/2 years the ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased June 2015, after about 2 1/2 years the material just basically rotted away, not sure if that is normal, but it has a 3 year guarantee, we will see if they guarantee it, stay tuned I will let you know what they say...2/15/18 2/28/18, I said I would update my review after I heard from Classic, Classic Accessories took care of me 100%. They sent me a new cover even though my tag number was not legible. I am very pleased and will continue to purchase Classic Products. I received my new cover under warranty on 2/28/18. They are a great company to do business with and they warranty their products. Bill B
customer_reviews.author: Bill Birdwell

customer_reviews.title: Only last 1-2 months!
customer_reviews.text: We had our cover on our trailer from the time I purchased May 1 to June 30 (2 months). I thought the cover worked great until we went to take it off and realized that the entire top of the cover was all ripped! The top part of the cover is paper thin material not like the sides. So the cover was all torn up on the top of our trailer. Not sure if it was from the sun, wind or I’m guessing just poor quality. I wanted to return and get my $200 back but return window closed June 3. I didn’t realize I only had a month! Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: rachelle1

customer_reviews.title: Keep the straps taught and it’ll hold up.
customer_reviews.text: Held up through a mild winter in western pa. Minimal snow and ice this year and only a few real bad winds. Cover held up well with no holes or tears. I did make sure to tighten the straps a few times throughout the winter. I also made sure to pad any protruding sharp bits like the antenna and the door catch. Installation was pretty easy on a calm day with two people and a decent length of pvc o help it over the ac. Make sure to put it away dry if you want to keep it nice
customer_reviews.author: Ferdnand

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Its unfortunate that the cover size is a range. It fit my 26’ RV big of course but was unable to secure it better without tearing or straining the material. A few windy days tore up the cover to shreads within the first month of owning it. Not a good buy.... save yourself the $300+ and invest double... triple the price on a better fit and better quality cover instead
customer_reviews.author: lbm

customer_reviews.title: Quality cover
customer_reviews.text: I've used Classic before and I love their products. Very durable and quality. My only frustration with this one was the setup instructions were unclear. Also, it says to put on roof and "unfold" but it wasn't folded properly so I was on the roof of my trailer trying to figure it out. We should have unpacked it in our living room and then refolded it to go on the trailer. Other than that, though, it has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: that this cover will work great.
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what all the negative reviewers are dealing with, but we have had this item installed on our 1977 Coachman Cadet trailer in some major wind storms, snow, and rain, and so far after a couple of months the cover is holding up very well. I suspect that if you follow the directions, cover up any sharp edges, and secure the straps snug but not too tight, that this cover will work great.
customer_reviews.author: Bhambrew

customer_reviews.title: Corners for down spout must be more durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought cover in February. Put cover on my trailer I covered down spouts with swimming noodles as recommended and today I noticed there's hole where down spout on other side seems he appears soon. After 3 month already falling apart disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, when I went to uncover my camper after five months of being covered, I discovered three tears in my brand new cover. It was a very mild winter in this part of PA and was surprised to see the holes. Definitely not worth the money. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. White

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Overall it’s nice. The fabric was thinner than I expected. This will be it’s first winter so we’ll see how it holds up. The tarp was folded and as a former truck driver. In my opinion it’s much easier to deal with a tarp that has minimal folding and have it rolled from one end to the other. What took me 45 minutes to do could be done in 20 if rolled instead of folded.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Weak Seams
customer_reviews.text: Seams between white roof panel and grey sides deteriorated from AZ summer sun and summer wind storms. After just a few months, the side panels were on the ground and the roof panel in shreds. Clearly this RV cover will not hold up to adverse weather.
customer_reviews.author: SunGuy in PEC

customer_reviews.title: Great Company Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought one last year & worked well that winter. Then we had terrible wind in the spring & it got ruined. It was replaced (3yr warranty) no problems. NOTE: I traded my 26 ft Jayco for a 23 ft Sonic & as I requested they replaced the cover with a different model that is a better fit for my new 23 ft camper. I am very happy with the company and the customer service. I am hopeful that this one will survive our rural weather in Western Illinois.
customer_reviews.author: Farmers Inc

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage. Didn't even last a season.
customer_reviews.text: This cover is absolute trash. We received this in February and it didn't even make it through July. This cover practically SHREDDED apart!! No way this is even remotely worth the price when it can't even survive 5 months. Don't waste your money, find a different cover. Even if it magically doesn't fall apart on you, the installation is difficult and it doesn't even keep the rain out. Absolutely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Iris V.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: Biggest piece of garbage you could buy. Barely lasted the winter. Bought in November. Took it off today, full of holes and rips. I live in southern Ohio, no high winds. I installed correctly and fasten it down correctly. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gambill

customer_reviews.title: Decent cover, one defect
customer_reviews.text: I waited a season to write this review because I was curious how this cover would hold up to Western PA winter. So far it has lasted a full season and part of another. I hope to get 3 seasons out of it. Durability is fine, I can see that the cover will likely rip on the gutter spouts, I would recommend anyone using these to cut a pool noodle and place it over them. There is a defect on my cover, the top white portion is held down by velcro, however mine only had one side of the velcro installed. It means the sides of the cover are always up. This can be seen in the photo provided.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Fits 23-foot travel trailer well
customer_reviews.text: Covered our 2011 Forest River Salem Cruise Lite 171RBXL fine. It's a 23-foot travel trailer. The front end is aerodynamic and curved, and the cover does have quite a bit of extra fabric up front, which needs to be cinched up. Hopefully high winds won't cause everything to flap too much. I believe it's designed for a boxier trailer. There's an extra cover that comes with this, that has velcro on it. I'm not exactly sure what it's for, as it's way too big for the power tongue jack control unit. Any thoughts?
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Good cover
customer_reviews.text: The instruction showed just on rolling it and then spreading it out to fall over the sides of the trailer. It came rolled up backwards and upside down so I had to flip it and turn it. It would’ve been much easier if it was rolled up the way that it should’ve been to just unroll and spread out. It fit well and it seems to be a good cover I’ll know more after this winter.
customer_reviews.author: gtoone

customer_reviews.title: For the price, not bad
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 27' to 30' to cover a 28 foot 1970 Winnebago back in March of 2017. The RV has pretty much remained under this cover except for the few times we were able to use the RV. Classic Winnebagos like mine have sharp edges and corners, so I expected it to be torn up and questioned if it would make it through an Ohio winter. It now has a few small rips, all in areas with sharp corners, but should last at least another winter. Very pleased, will probably buy another before the 2019 winter starts.
customer_reviews.author: Dilbert

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in the fall to cover our RV during the harsh Colorado winters. We will see how waterproof and durable it is after this winter season. So far, materials and fit seem perfect for our travel trailer. The average ratings are just because we haven't gone thru a winter yet. Will update after the winter.
customer_reviews.author: R D

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 30 foot long camper and read reviews suggesting buy the longer cover. We did and it went on very easily and is plenty long. The straps were great for getting it snug. We also made sure to put pool noodles over the drip spouts on top. It has held up well this first winter here in MI. We will see how it does once we take it off and try again next year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasting Cover
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Classic Accessories Overdrive cover we have purchased. This one is for a smaller travel trailer. The first one is in the middle of its third winter on our 30 foot travel trailer and it is still in great condition. I believe the key is to get the right size and take the time to protect areas that can tear the cover. In order to do this I use pipe insulators.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Bad instructions
customer_reviews.text: The installation instructions are completely wrong, you cannot roll the cover oust as it says, it must be unfolded. Highly disappointed in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: RV cover
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on, seemed durable until one week later we noticed a tear on the seam/flap that exposed the trailer roof. We had to put a tie down around the trailer to keep it from tearing more. We haven’t had any really windy days yet but they are coming so I’m hoping it doesn’t tear anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: matthecj

customer_reviews.title: It's got you covered
customer_reviews.text: this cover is amazing I've had I've had it for two season now and it seems to really fit my RV well it definitely keeps the wind and snow and rain from really doing any damage during the winter season it's easy enough to put on that my wife and I can do it ourselves with minimal effort would definitely purchase this again if I lost it or if it broke or something but great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Rocky A. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to protect my trailer and within a few months had a few tears and the snaps broke off. The cover still protected the trailer and can tell a difference between the trailers in our storage facility that have not covered their trailer as they show the sun damage. The top of the cover is still in good shape and provided the protection that I was looking for in a cover. For this reason alone I would recommend the cover...but the customer service regarding the product warranty was outstanding. They replied promptly with the information that was needed and they have sent out another cover. I would recommend Classic Accessories products for their customer service alone.
customer_reviews.author: dharr

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Keeping the sun off the trailer, and I live in Phoenix. We get sun.
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with the cover. I read the reviews before I made my purchase. One review said to order the next size larger because they sizing was off. I'm not sure this guy could read a tape measure. I followed his advice and now have a cover that is to big. Order the size you need. Suggestion to the manufacturer, you should make a cover that is shorter on the sides. The top cover is great, try making the sides come down maybe 3 or 4 feet. Would be much easier to put on the trailer. The top of the trailer is what I really needed to protect.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Alsup

customer_reviews.title: Make sure all sharp corners are covered.
customer_reviews.text: I put the cover on our camper trailer today. It arrived last night. We followed the instructions and it went on pretty easy. The hardest part was getting it on top of the camper. I cut a swimming noodle like someone else said to do in one of your reviews and put a piece on each gutter spout. It fit perfectly on the gutter spout. We took our time installing the cover and it went on easily. Don’t pull the straps too tight. Just snugg them. Monitor the staps durning windy times and tighten as needed. So far very good product. Will update as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Piner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service
customer_reviews.text: Awesome customer service!!!! Stands behind product. I live in a mild climate 65 in winter and 85 in summer. So Cal 3 miles from the ocean. Some heavy winds once or twice a winter. The cover lasted close to two years on the trailer 24/7/365 when not Camping. They stood behind their warranty. It will get holes around corners but all covers do that. I did not do a warranty claim for that issue. They sent a replacement because the fabric wore out prior to the warranty term. Again great company great products best price. My patio furniture covers are from the same company and 2 years out still looking good on those too.
customer_reviews.author: Verenis R.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Seemed great when we put it on in October. However, by spring it was completely trashed. The material seemed to crumble apart due to the sun and elements. It quickly became brittle and tore. Would not recommend if you live in the north. Might be fine somewhere else, but was a total waste of money here.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L.C.M.

customer_reviews.title: Unroll on ground before trying to install.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were not useful. Item was packed wrong side up, had to flip over on top of trailer to install. Fit was very good for 22ft. Nash. Looks good but we will see about durability, seems thin on sides. Unroll cover on ground and check before trying to install on top of trailer. Watch sharp corners and you will be fine. For the price I am happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk! Disintegrated in 2 months!
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Disintegrated in 2 months! I could ask for a warranty replacement, but Why? There is no reason to get a replacement because it would only last two months as well. I live in the desert. This cover has no uv protection for itself. The top breathable white fabric powdered & disintegrated. No Bueno!
customer_reviews.author: bomberojr

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money! It can’t handle the wind.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money! The cover arrived and looked good and went on our trailer with ease. All seemed well. Then the winds came and it didn’t last more than a month. The cover is now shredded and has been thrown away. There is no reason to buy this item unless you live somewhere with no wind. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Man in the yellow hat.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a year.
customer_reviews.text: We just took this off our camper after a pretty light winter. Several holes. Tarp wore thru at the corner of the bumper (which is rounded not even sharp), at the spouts on each corner. Very disappointed. Fit the camper well. the straps work well to make it snug. We really thought we would get at least 3-4 winters with it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Pasatiempo

customer_reviews.title: rv cover
customer_reviews.text: Not ready like instructions says it is, before getting on the roof of the trailer unroll the cover and turn it inside out like most cover manufactures suggest and then haul it up on the roof. When the cover is inside out it is easy to throw it on the roof and put the sides down on each side.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R

customer_reviews.title: Appears to have dry rotted after less than 6 months of part time use
customer_reviews.text: Have had this cover for less than 6 months. Cover was not used all the time since it was purchased over the summer and trailer was in use. So total use out of the 6 months was probably about 50-60%. I live in central North Carolina and have not experienced any significant storms that would justify this kind of damage to the cover. Cover appears like dry rot damage I have experienced from living in dry desert climates. But this has been used in sunny but humid climates. Cover is destroyed. That white stuff on the ground in the first picture is the cover tattered to pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality... Do not purchase... Lasted less than a year... top turned into powder
customer_reviews.text: Top decayed into a fine powder in well less than a year. Now left with a pile of garbage. Was not expecting much, but certainly not expecting to replace in 10 months . It is a cover that's sole purpose is to protect.... I guess it needs it's own cover? Worst purchase decision, do not buy! Would rate negative if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hammond

customer_reviews.title: This is our second Classic Polypro 3 cover
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Classic Polypro 3 cover, 1st one lasted about 3 years. Rain gutters pretty much ripped it right away however we continued to use until it shredded. My tip is to cut an X in tennis balls and place them over your gutters to protect your cover. The size fits well and we’re very satisfied with the price, hardly ever see covers less than $180. This is a lightweight cover. The top is white color so stays cooler, plenty of venting and seems to repel water well. We have a Rockwood mini lite 25’ 11” on specs however measured 23 1/2’ coach. I bought the 22-24’ model 3.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in less than 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t even last 2 months ... Purchased mid June, installed right after. Just went to the storage lot to pick up the trailer to find the top had started to disintegrate. Picture was of just one spot. Multiple tears across the top. Unbelievable. This is in the Sacramento area ... no rain, now wind storms to speak of. Just an average dry hot summer. Wow! Totally disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JRW

customer_reviews.title: ... these for my last Arctic Fox and it worked great! I used it three years and it held ...
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for my last Arctic Fox and it worked great! I used it three years and it held up great. I sold that trailer and bought another Arctic Fox so I bought another "Classic". It's very important to make sure that when you cover your trailer that you take care of any sharp corners or attachments that could tear your cover. Also, make sure your furnace is off! If it turns on when your cover is on it will burn a hole in it. Not that I've done that! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Showalter

customer_reviews.title: Appeared great when first purchased
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to cover my RV. it did not survive one winter. When I began to take it off this spring, the white portion literally crumbled away. There were numerous tears in the cover. Not what I expected for durability. Not satisfied with product. Will not recommend it either.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for price
customer_reviews.text: First season using cover Fits well and secure points for straps seem well constructed. Took advice of other reviews and went one size bigger and it also covered propane tanks. Also added foam to sharp corners to reduce chance of tears. Since camper is in a seasonal campground cannot answer question on durability until next year. pros like the zipper door areas and roll up panels. Cons. Instructions say start at front and roll towards back then fold out sides. Only rolled half way to back then had to start unfolding side to side then to back again. Not a big deal
customer_reviews.author: Tony Ny

customer_reviews.title: Save your time and money !!
customer_reviews.text: Save your time and money !!! As soon as we tightened the straps they all tore !!! Then try to get it back in the small box for a return !!! Ridiculous !
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Durability
customer_reviews.text: Had this product on since February 2020, It can not handle to much wind at all. Mine has rips on the corners both up top and down low. I would not recommend this product unless you live somewhere you do not have any wind. The durability is extremely poor.
customer_reviews.author: C. H.

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Not satisfied at all. We put the cover on for the first time and the front straps ripped out of the material to cinch it up causing a hole and us having to figure out how to remedy the problem as we already fought to get it on. Also, the cover came with no paperwork about the product to fill out for the warranty which is understandable considering how cheaply made it is, and there are no straps included with the cover to go under the rv to hold the bottom edge from flapping up in the wind and rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Buckles

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, I did it by myself, it would be nice with 2 person minimum. Make sure there isn't any wind and you be glad. Make sure it is very tight and that the wind can't blow it up like a balloon. It should last several years, if you have it tight, if not, you will need to purchase a new one each year. My last one made it through 5 years of bad weather in WI. I also use shrink wrap to go around the sides to secure it even more and put tires on top to secure the top from blowing up like a balloon....bottom line, you need it tight to last.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley J Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart quickly
customer_reviews.text: After 6 weeks in the summer sun and wind, the fabric turned into dust. Made the trailer dusty, also a huge mess when I took the cover off. I bought Another one for a great price and I don’t think I am going to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K.

customer_reviews.title: camper is covered
customer_reviews.text: I have not covered my camper in the past but was always afraid of leaks. This took about 30 minuets to install. It fits as it should. It has only been on for about two months of a NH winter but is holding up fine. Its not super heavy but seems to be working just fine. I did put a pool noodle on all sharp corners and rain spouts.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Blakley

customer_reviews.title: Didnt hold up
customer_reviews.text: Product seemed to be of good quality but it only lasted 5 months before it started falling apart from the exposure to the sun during our hot summer months(usually between 100-118 degrees). I wouldnt recomend to any one that lives in a hot desert climate.
customer_reviews.author: Koko

customer_reviews.title: RV Cover
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a good quality cover for our travel trailer. So far we've had up to 50 MPH winds with no problem. I very pleased with it. The way it was originally rolled up made it difficult to put on, but I eventually got it done and it fits well.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Good quality material
customer_reviews.text: It fit well. Good quality material. Attention to detail. Many straps and other tie-down options. LOVED the Stone Throw Bag! I measured my trailer at the bottom frame for size. I did not take into account that, due to the slope on the front wall of the travel trailer, the cover would be loose at the top. In hindsight, I should have ordered one size smaller. All said and done, I would absolutely order another cover from this seller in a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. and Mrs. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for my usage.
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out the front and back, it went on easier than I thought it would. I needed 2 ladders and a helper but, it did fit great and was easy to put on after only a few minutes of searching for the tag in front. Ground had too many leaves to roll it out like the directions say to do. Probably the only reason I had any trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Tedd

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit, fairly easy install, but tore easily
customer_reviews.text: First heavy wind last winter ripped it wide open across the fabric (wasn’t at a corner or anything that would tear it, wasn’t along a seam). Fits snug with the adjustment straps, just wasn’t as durable as we’d hoped. Still using this year (winter #2) with an extra rope tied around the camper, across the ripped area. Hopefully that’ll keep things together for another year or two.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Everson

customer_reviews.title: The White top material failed in 5 months
customer_reviews.text: The cover fit well, was fairly easy to install. The white roof material does not stand up to uv rays. The top failed, not from wind but from the sun. The top started coming apart in little pieces found all over the yard. The material that the sides are made of held up quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Pappy

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit early for a true assessment however initial reviews are very positive. I just put this cover on my travel trailer a couple days ago and yesterday into today we have had sustained winds in excess of 30mph with higher gust and the cover is intact with no rips or tears. It was relatively easy to install and the tie downs hold it securely in place. So far so good
customer_reviews.author: Thomas N. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great cover (so far)!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cover! I’ve only had it on my camper for a month or so, but it still looks brand new. It has zippers located where you need them and they unzip all the way to the top. Someone really but some thought into this. The size I ordered was a little longer than I actually needed, so I covered all they way to the hitch!
customer_reviews.author: Tomfooter

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: a little thin, hope it last all winter in Montana! 4 Stars Initially Well, Winters Over and it did not Hold up as i'd like Heavy Snowfall and Ice took it's toll and caused some Rips I will say it is light weight and easy to cover my Camper I will reduce my rating to 3 Stars, since it did rip and tear in places from Snow and Ice. I'd recommend this for more inside Storage with Low Wind and no exposure to the Elements.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: HD as advertised. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: Think cover will be great. Put it on to make sure it fits (with Amazon cannot return after 30 days). Purchased same brand lighter duty last time for smaller trailer we had. This one looks to be very heavy duty think I will like it even better. Easy to install. Easier if two people install it one on ground and one up on top. Opening in canvas for back side door harder to use than lighter canvas cover. Look forward to using cover this winter. Would rate it 4.7 because of access to side back door.
customer_reviews.author: Azteccptclnr

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy duty trailer cover.
customer_reviews.text: This easily covered our 26’ Avenger travel trailer with room to spare. Directions were easy. Do not attempt cover the propane tanks or ball hitch. It leave too much room underneath for wind to lift and pull the cover. Corners and pull downs where straps are attached are reinforced and so far don’t seem as if they will rip. Took about an hour to fully cover on my first attempt but I did it alone so it’s not too cumbersome. I’ll update more after our first winter to see how it held up.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Rips easily
customer_reviews.text: Just put this on our 31' camper and it is huge. We probably have 4' or 5' to spare, bought the 30'-33' one thinking it would be perfect. Spent $180 on this to have it rip on the drain spout within the first 5 minutes. Very disappointing. I hope that it holds up this winter. Should have paid more attention to the reviews. On a positive it was pretty easy to get on.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Brink

customer_reviews.title: Nice durable cover
customer_reviews.text: Nice durable cover. Need two people to put on. I have a 21’ toy hauler and it fits perfect with extra room. The straps that go under the belly of the trailer keep all movement down. I put it on before we had a 50mph windstorm and it help up! Dumping rain it ran right off. I don’t know why anyone wouldn’t buy a cover for there trailers. This saves the life of them
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted less than a month! It went on perfectly and fit very well, so we had high hopes. It survived the first windstorm but not the second one. It ripped end to end along the top. We were still within the 30 day return, so we boxed it up and sent it back. No problem with the return.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. A.

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly and seems well made for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fits like a glove. Went on very easily. It was my fault that I did not cover a sharp drip edge on the rear of my travel trailer, the corner caught the cover and ripped a 1 inch hole immediately, but I guess that is expected. I cut some half inch rubber fuel line and covered the sharp edges . The cover came extremely well packaged, we will see how the provided straps hold up in the winter winds. For the price I I’m currently very happy, but will revisit my review after the winter season.
customer_reviews.author: James E

customer_reviews.title: Did'nt make it 2 winters
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in late 2018, It was inexpensive but had 4 star. I contacted customer service today 1/30/2020. will update review when I hear back.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H.

customer_reviews.title: Not so sure this is worth $200+
customer_reviews.text: Rain fall made the entire thing transparent and the rv is soaked. Not sure if it’s doing anything except maybe keeping bird poo off of it..... now I’m worried there will be mold growth under the cover due to all the moisture inside.....
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and got it for Christmas. Put it on by myself today. For what it is, it is simple enough to install even alone. (I had a slight breeze and it was catching wind. Not the product's fault.) I have a 28' camper and it fit well. A little long, but that was expected. Hopefully it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: fell apart within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: this product is absolutely horrible. Within 3 months it totally fell apart, shredded in the weather which has not been bad weather at all.. totally flimsy. would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Orner

customer_reviews.title: Severely Disappointed On Durability but Customer Service is great!
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like it was going to be fantastic. But after one day there are tears and holes everywhere. Update: Classic Accessories is sending me a new cover so I increased my stars from 1 to 3. I'll update it again if this one survives longer than a day.
customer_reviews.author: CindyS

customer_reviews.title: Fit like a loose glove...
customer_reviews.text: Fit like a loose glove... I have a hybrid and the box is 19.5 feet long they only make a 22-24 foot boxt cover thus, this was the smallest cover they make... But I gotta say it fit pretty good and it breathes which is the most important part... There have been complaints by others that it tears rather easily... With that advice in mind My wife stood on the tongue of the trailer and I was on the roof and the kids on each side and we slowly put her on with zero issues...
customer_reviews.author: Joel Chappell

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: This is thinner than expected, but it’s doing the job so far. It has been a mild winter, though. This was interesting to put over the camper, to say the least. But, when you’re wrapping a camper, don’t expect it to be easy
customer_reviews.author: Marla McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Ripped in about 1 year!  SUn and a little rain (Southern California).
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in January, 2019. Only had it on the trailer about 1 year. Ripped on the top at the A/C unit and vent cover, no sharp edges! Starting to rip at the fridge vent. See the photos. VERY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Commenter

customer_reviews.title: Top disintegrated after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 2 months ago and went to remove it from our trailer and the ENTIRE top had disintegrated. We literally looked like we were covered in snow from all of the particles that fell while trying to take the cover off. Because the top was gone it made it very difficult to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cover because it fits my camper like a glove. I was skeptical on ordering a cover because I was afraid of them being too small or too big. I have a 38ft camper with a 35ft box and this cover exceeded my expectations because it fit so perfectly the quick snap straps that hold the cover in place are quick and easy. I practically installed the whole cover by myself besides having a friend hand it up to me while I was on top of the camper. I found it easiest to completely stretch out the ground prior to sliding it over the camper.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 minutes until a strap tore off
customer_reviews.text: Looks very nice except one of the straps ripped off the main cover. Have to try and use zip ties to put it back on or you cannot tighten the cover. I think could be problematic if get too windy it potentially could blow up and expose unit as its wouldn't he tightened.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Held up well over a rough winter with snows over a foot at times. The only flaw is that the flaps on the top do not stick to the Velcro when it's windy. This causes them to blow up onto the roof leaving the vents exposed to the rain and snow. For the money it would be worth it to buy this and rig something to hold them down. Not sure why they even took the time to put them on there since the sides seem breathable.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

product_meta.title: Classic Accessories Over Drive PolyPRO3 Deluxe Travel Trailer Cover or Toy Hauler Cover, Fits 30' - 33' RVs - Max Weather Protection with 3-Ply Poly Fabric Roof Travel Trailer Cover (73663)
product_meta.description: Size:Fits 30' - 33' TrailersDurable PolyPRO3™ RV covers provide streamlined, strong protection that stands out from the pack. When you buy from Classic Accessories, you’ll receive peace of mind along with your product, thanks to the easiest warranty in the industry. If you’re disappointed with your purchase within the warranty period, look for us online and take advantage of our Hassle-Free warranty program supported by our US-based team.
feature_bullets: Travel Trailer Cover: Fits travel trailers & toy haulers 30' - 33' long, 118" high from ground to roof
The thick triple-ply top defends your RV from rain, snow, dirt, and scratches for all-season protection
Adjustable tension panels and elasticized hem corners provide a custom-like fit, while air vents reduce wind stress and inside moisture

Zippered panels allow access to the RV doors and engine areas while integrated straps and toss bag system allow for quick installation. Stuff sacks are included on all covers and ladder caps are included on most

specifications.Cover Included: Classic Accessories Inc 73663 Polypro 3 Deluxe Travel Trailer Cover - 30' To 33'
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,661 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
